department.name: Eidgenössisches Departement für Wirtschaft, Bildung und Forschung
Département fédéral de l'économie, de la formation et de la recherche
Dipartimento federale dell'economia, della formazione e della ricerca
Federal Department of Economic Affairs, Education and Research

content.title: PRESS CONFERENCE
content.teaser: Trade Policy Review of SwitzerlandPress conference by the Swiss delegation
content.lead: Trade Policy Review of SwitzerlandPress conference by the Swiss delegation
content.text:
The Swiss delegation will organize a Press Conference on

Friday, 17 December 2004

WTO Building, Room B, 13:00

On December 15 and 17, 2004, the Members of the World Trade Organization have reviewed the Trade Policy of Switzerland (for the fourth time after 1991, 1996 and 2000) on the basis of a Report by the WTO Secretariat which also includes Liechtenstein. Both countries have also submitted their own Report for this review. The Swiss delegation will inform the press on this Trade Policy Review.

After that, Ambassador Luzius Wasescha, Delegate of the Swiss Governement for Trade Agreements, will inform on the latest developments in the framework of the actual Doha Round negotiations, including the discussions that members had this week on Agriculture.

Please also note that, immediately after the end of the Press Conference, Switzerland will issue a Press Release regarding the Trade Policy Review (in French and German) and will make available the related Press Documentation (in French and German). Additional documents for the press will also include the Report by the Government of Switzerland and Liechtenstein (in French) as well as the Preliminary Summary Observations by the WTO Secretariat (in French).

Berne/Geneva, December 15 2004

For further information:
Rita Baldegger
Spokeswoman
State Secretariat for Economic Affairs
Tel. +41 (0)31 323 37 90

Didier Chambovey
Minister
Permanent Mission of Switzerland to WTO and EFTA
Tel. +41 (0)22 749 25 12


Mandatory in order to enter the WTO:
ONU ID press card, OMC ID press card or ID press card. Holders of the latest will have to get a temporary badge as they come in at the WTO.
